Title: Ebonyi indigene receives N2m for trekking to appreciate federal lawmaker
Summary: Ebonyi indigene, Emmanuel Obasi, receives N2m for trekking from Ilorin, Kwara, to Abakaliki . The trekking venture was to appreciate the good works of a federal lawmaker, Dr Nkemkanmma Kama .

Title: Police detain fake ‘Obi of Lagos’
Summary: Police detain a self-proclaimed traditional ruler who unlawfully paraded himself as the ‘Obi of Lagos’ during an unauthorised installation ceremony . The command deputy spokesperson, DSP Babaseyi Oluseyi, confirmed the detaining .

Title: INEC recognises Mark-led ADC leadership
Summary: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) has officially recognised the Sen. David Mark-led National Working Committee (NWC) of the African Democratic Congress (ADC) As of Wednesday, the commission uploaded the names of the committee members .

Title: WHO says to remain in Gaza City despite Israel’s call to leave
Summary: WHO says to remain in Gaza City despite calls from Israel’s military for people to flee an assault it is mounting there . “To civilians in Gaza: WHO and partners remain in . Gaza City,” the UN health agency said Wednesday .

Title: Ghana accepting west Africans deported from US
Summary: Ghana is accepting West Africans deported from the United States . Deporting people to third countries has been a hallmark of US President Donald Trump’s crackdown on immigrants . Deportation of people has been the hallmark of the US President's crackdown on illegal immigrants .

Title: Dangote, NUPENG face-off: Lessons for stakeholders
Summary:
While the strike has been suspended and operations resumed, NUPENG leaders have vowed to remain vigilant

Title: Apapa Customs set new record of N20.1bn daily revenue generation
Summary: Apapa Customs has set a new record posting N20.1 billion daily revenue . The latest record-breaking collection now stands as the highest daily revenue of any command in the Nigeria Customs Service . Comptroller Emmanuel Oshoba took over the leadership of the command yesterday .

Title: FIRS, EFCC strengthen alliance to enforce voluntary tax compliance
Summary: Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS) and Economic and Financial Crimes Commission renewed their commitment to closer collaboration . The FIRS Executive Chairman, Dr Zacch Adedeji, emphasised the need to enforce voluntary tax compliance .

Title: Carter Bridge irredeemable — Umahi
Summary: Federal Government has said that the situation of Carter Bridge in Lagos State was critical . All stakeholders must realise that the bridge is irredeemable, says Umahi .

Title: Parents, others support campaign against single-use textbooks
Summary: Parents, others support campaign against single-use textbooks . "The antics of publishers to get their stocks depleted quickly by making parents buy books yearly is not sustainable"

Title: Don’t judge ADC on by-election losses — Spokesperson
Summary: By-elections held on August 16 to fill seats left vacant by deaths or resignations after the 2023 polls, produced no wins for the party . The All Progressives Grand Alliance took two seats in Anambra and the New Nigeria Peoples Party one in Kano .

Title: Tinubu to address world leaders at UN General Assembly
Summary: Nigeria’s President Bola Tinubu will address the 80th Session of the high-level General Debate of the United Nations General Assembly at the UN headquarters in New York on Wednesday, September 24 . The Nigerian leader is scheduled to deliver his address to other world leaders during the afternoon session, around 8:30 pm local time

Title: French commission recommends banning social media for children under 15
Summary: A French parliamentary commission probing the psychological effects of TikTok recommends banning social media for children under 15 and adopting a “digital curfew” for 15- to 18-year-olds . Such a ban would “send a signal to both children and parents that before the age of 15, ‘social media’ is not

Title: 720,000 people commit suicide annually — WHO
Summary: The Director-General of WHO, Tedros Ghebreyesus, is calling for “shifting the narrative” on the issue to challenge harmful myths, reduce stigma, and foster compassionate conversations . Suicide is the third leading cause of death among 15–29-year-olds globally in 2021, the last year for

Title: Chelle issues Eagles rallying cry as World Cup dreams slip
Summary: Nigeria drew 1-1 with South Africa in their final Group C qualifier in Bloemfontein . South Africa top the standings with 17 points, while Benin Republic occupy the crucial second position with 14 points . Nigeria have been to six World Cup finals since their debut in USA 1994 . Head coach, Eric Chelle remains defiant
